metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12105 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: OpenConnect through 8.08 mishandles negative return values from X509_check_ function calls, which might assist attackers in performing man-in-the-middle attacks.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This only affects openconnect when built with OpenSSL. Debian and Ubuntu packages are built with GnuTLS, so are not affected.

criterions.comment: openconnect: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
